alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 18 at 1:55PM MST until August 18 at 4:30PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON FOR THE DONEY PARK AREA... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of Flagstaff...Specifically the Doney Park in Coconino County. * WHEN...Until 300 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Dangerous flooding over low-water crossings. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 152 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in Doney Park. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Doney Park is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... San Francisco Wash. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience minor flooding include... Flagstaff, Hutchison Acres, Doney Park, Timberline and Little Elden Spring Horse Camp. - This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 89 between mile markers 420 and 427. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Flooding of washes and creeks will occur, some dirt roads will become muddy and impassable. Paved roads and underpasses could become flooded as well. In hilly or mountainous terrain, there are many low water crossings which will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
